Articles.Content:
I will press it, I hope I keep my middle finger thumb and pointer so i can still play Kerbal

Press the Button to rid the world of Justin Beiber and One Direction, but it has a 5% chance of it Turning those two into Dictators that command their fans

I press it, aren't they already dictators for their fans?

Press the button for Jeb to be a pilot that you can pay to fly your missions, but he enjoys doing the wrong things and trying to land on jool.

I would not press it.

If you press the button, Pluto becomes a planet again! The side effect is that the other dwarf planets (Ceres, Makemake, Eris, Haumea, Sedna, ect...) become planets too.

*smashes button* ANYTHING FOR PLUTO!

Press the button to have Jeb as your co-pilot, but he straps boosters onto your car (not saying it's unsafe )

Well, the MythBusters did it, so... *boop*

Press to have a 50/50 chance of turning into Anna or Elsa.

Nope, never liked frozen in the frst place.

press the button to have a failed trip to the MÃƒÂ¼n!

Nope.

Press to have a 50/50 chance of turning into Anna or Elsa.

HET.

Press the button to turn into President Barack Hussein Obama.

*boop*

press button to turn into a hippopotamus.

I am fine just being a human.

The button gives you a super power, but you don't know what it is. You might get the ability to manipulate snot or something stupid like that.

*presses button like crazy*

If I don't like the superpower, I could just not use it.

The button gives you a very large (the size of your head, most likely) hat.

No thanks.

You press the button to get one extra sense, but you must endure the pain of an inch long and quarter inch deep cut being made and the healing (no pain meds or ice even, just a stick to bite on).

Well, that extra sense is insta-regeneration. *press*

Press to have a 95/5 chance of either turning into Anna or managing to land on Eeloo with 300 crafts. (95% turning into Anna, 5% Eeloo)

Press it I have luck (no one jinks me) that it will be eeloo.

Press the button to be able to hold your breath forever, but you will have very dry skin when out of water.

I'm guessing being able to hold my breath forever makes me immortal, so yes.

Press the button to drop the loud noises. But there will be loud noises on the ground, until they're cleaned up.

Edited November 25, 2014 by Tery215

No pressing here!

Press the button to have mind control. However, you can only use it for the gain of the rich and only if you're not rich.

Rich people have too much money as is, so no.

The button costs a dollar to press, but it has a 50% chance of giving you two dollars.

Nah, I dont have a dollar.

This button carries great power. Press it, and you get wealth beyond any of your dreams. However, you'll be hated accros the universe, and are forced to live alone. Even animals hate you.

*boop*

don't care, I'll hate everyone back xD

Press button to have a live crocodile in your room.

No, I am really weak and slow so I will be ripped to shreds.

Press the button to either be given 9348 trillion dollars that you can spend without inflation {90% chance}, or be stuck ASL on Eve with no fuel, and no chance of anyone rescuing you {10% chance}.

I'd press it, worth it to be able to be on eve.

You can have an extra sense (not superpower) but you must endure the pain of getting a inch deep and two inch long wound and the pain of it healing.

I am not going to risk it.

The buttons perminaintly teleports you to the Kerbal universe.

Could I control and build ships still? What about feel kerbal pain? I'd press it.

The button will give you an infinite amount of whatever you choose, but it will only last for a year.

Heck yeah!

You have absolutely no idea what the button does.

I don't push it.

If you push the button you have infinite money to spend as you please, but everywhere you spend money goes out of business shortly after.
